pageTitle: Public event for November 11, 2015 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Public event for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Wednesday, November 11, 2015:

Ottawa

11:00 a.m.

The Prime Minister and Ms. Sophie Grégoire-Trudeau will participate in the National Remembrance Day Ceremony.

They will be joined by: Their Excellencies the Right Honourable David Johnston, Governor General of Canada, and Mrs. Sharon Johnston; the Honourable Leo Housakos, Speaker of the Senate of Canada; the Honourable Stéphane Dion, Minister of Foreign Affairs; the Honourable Kent Hehr, Minister of Veterans Affairs and Associate Minister of National Defence; the Honourable Harjit Singh Sajjan, Minister of National Defence; General Jonathan Vance, Chief of the Defence Staff, Canadian Armed Forces; Mr. Tom Eagles, Dominion President, The Royal Canadian Legion; Mr. Brad White, Dominion Secretary, The Royal Canadian Legion; and Mrs. Sheila Anderson, 2015 National Memorial (Silver) Cross Mother.

National War Memorial
Elgin Street
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity only (cameras and photographers only)
  • Media covering the Prime Minister are asked to arrive at 10:15 a.m.
  • Media must be accredited through the Parliamentary Press Gallery

Ottawa

1:30 p.m.

The Prime Minister will visit the Hindu Temple of Ottawa-Carleton.
4835 Bank Street

Notes for media:
Photo opportunity only

Ottawa

2:45 p.m.

The Prime Minister will visit the Gurdwara Sahib Ottawa Sikh Society.
26 Gurdwara Road

Notes for media:

Photo opportunity only
PMO Media Relations: 613-957-5555
